page.title: 15ECOLOGY/WILDLIFE IN DUNMOW
page.content: Our block is predominantly rural and intensively cultivated,there are some remnants of the old forests.These have been preserved for shooting and hunting but also for conservational purposes.The farmers we interviewed all stressed their commitment to the preservation of the countryside.Many new trees are planted each year,and ponds and lakes created.There are deer in the forests and much wildlife, including pheasants which are reared for game.The preservation orders help to conserve the remaining woodland.The practice of enlarging fields by taking up hedges which has caused total concern in the past,has now ended.This year there are new laws concerning strawburning.The River Chelmer flows through the town,and is crossed by the old bridge at Churchend.It flows through the recreation ground.
